title: Hawks' Thabo Sefolosha plans to sue NYC, cops for up to $50 million
text:
Hawks' Thabo Sefolosha plans to sue NYC, cops for up to $50 million Sporting News 22 hrs ago Bob.Hille@performgroup.com (Bob Hille) © Seth Wenig/AP Photo Hawks swingman Thabo Sefolosha plans to sue the city of New York and eight police officers for up to $50 million for what he says are "permanent" injuries suffered when he was arrested April 7 outside a Manhattan nightclub, the New York Post reported .
AdChoices Although Sefolosha has played for the Hawks this exhibition season , the broken leg and ligament damage he suffered at the hands of arresting officers caused him to "become substantially disabled” and the “damages are permanent in nature and continuing into the future,” according to the notice of claim filed with New York's comptroller.
MORE: Sefolosha says NYPD hurt not just leg, but reputation
A New York jury acquitted Sefolosha earlier this month on all three counts against him—disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and obstructing governmental administration — related to the incident, opening the door for the lawsuit.
Police claimed that Sefolosha, 31, refused to obey orders to clear the area near 1OAK when Chris Copeland and others were stabbed outside the celebrity hot spot.
Sefolosha’s attorney, Alex Spiro, said his client's subsequent performance on the court doesn’t mean he wasn’t permanently injured in the incident.
“Unfortunately," Spiro said, "he may not be dunking as much as he was before this happened.”
